items.content:
Telmar

Web Application Developer

verified
United States or Canada (Central or Eastern Standard Time Zone)
Telmar (https://www.telmar.com/), the world’s largest independent provider of strategic targeting and media planning solutions for advertisers and data suppliers is seeking a Web Application Developer with an interest in the media planning industry and the technology that surrounds it. This is a remote-first opportunity for candidates residing in a Central or Eastern Standard Time Zone, USA, and Canada. We are building a rapidly growing global software development team that will leverage intuitive software, robust analysis and data visualization techniques that reveal hidden insights from reliable but complex data sources to deliver sound strategies for our clients worldwide. In this role, you will be designing, developing, and maintaining applications that are deployed on our cloud-delivered platform. This role will initially be focused on TOPS, Telmar’s Out of Home Application, a product that is integral to the Telmar product platform and provides a comprehensive outdoor advertising planning system with detailed site level and market average reach and frequency evaluation. As a crucial part of a dynamic agile team, you will collaborate with very experienced business leaders and technologists in the media planning industry and will have an awesome opportunity to expand your business acumen as well as build cutting-edge technology essential to the media planning industry. This position also offers significant opportunities for growth technically and in management, especially in DevOps as we scale. As part of a team that focuses on talent ahead of location, Telmar values the ethos of work fitting lifestyle making it essential to this role that you: ❖ Can manage your own workflows and outcomes ❖ Are be comfortable with rapid-paced prototyping ❖ Can be dedicated to long term production stability ❖ Enjoy working with highly collaborative tools e.g. Confluence, JIRA, G-Chat, Meet, etc ❖ Are a highly effective communication, regardless of medium # Responsibilities ❖ Design, develop and maintain high-performance applications ❖ Interact with internal and external customers to understand their needs and work with other technical resources in the development of web applications to meet those needs ❖ Implement rich, interactive web applications using the latest technologies, frameworks, and patterns ❖ Test, measure, optimize performance, and engage in continuous improvement using appropriate tools # Requirements Required Skills & Experience: ❖ 3-5 years of experience in developing web applications/software ❖ Proven experience with Frontend Angular development, NodeJS, ElasticSearch, Git ❖ Advanced demonstrated fluency in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS ❖ Experience with Agile methodologies ❖ General knowledge and understanding of AWS ❖ Experience with JIRA ❖ Excellent problem-solving skills ❖ Proven ability to work effectively in a remote working environment ❖ Outstanding communication skills (written and verbal communication skills) ❖ Organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven ❖ Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work proactively, independently and as a team player ❖ Ability to work efficiently and productively in a fast-paced environment Preferred Technical Skills & Experience ❖ Experience with Angular Material, AWS SDK, Amazon Cognito, Lambda, SQL and Object database ❖ UX experience ❖ Experience with Java and other Cloud-based systems ❖ Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline #Salary $60,000 - $90,000 #Location - United States or Canada (Central or Eastern Standard Time Zone)

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=43}
items.content:
We are looking for an exceptional engineer to join our team to lead development on our front-end, which is an SPA built using Typescript + React + Blueprint.js.

Ideally, you should have over a year's experience using Typescript, in addition a modern framework such as React/Angular/Vue.js, and be excited by the prospect of building web apps that present complex ideas to users in a simple and intuitive manner. This is an ambitious project which includes interesting technical challenges, such as working with large multi-million row datasets in the browser, and parsing arrow files in the browser.

This will primarily involve work on the frontend, but -- depending on your experience -- this could also could include some backend Python/Django work including interfacing and developing our REST endpoints to make them compatible with front-end requirements.

You should like the idea of releasing to real customers regularly, and prioritise getting a great product into users’ hands for feedback and iteration. You will be working with a talented team of domain experts, data scientists, and backend engineers, and will have extensive scope to build and architect the front-end yourself, and grow the team in the future.

Please note, the role is fully remote - we subscribe to the GitLab global salary calculator - about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-operations/global-compensation/calculator . However we're looking for candidates located within Europe only at the moment.

items.content:
About Argent


Join us as we reimagine the future of money and the internet. Our mission is to make them more open and fair, driving new economic opportunities and putting people in control of their digital lives.


To start we've built the first crypto wallet with the simplicity and security of the best new bank apps - yet we never hold users’ assets. It takes the complexity out of Ethereum and is driven by our dedication to user experience.


We launched in 2018 and have a world-class team with experience scaling mobile apps to tens of millions of users. Our eclectic backgrounds include PhDs in nuclear physics and quantum cryptography. We’re fortunate to be backed by the top VCs in Europe, including Index Ventures, Creandum and firstminute capital.


The Senior Javascript Engineer role


You'll lead the development of several important areas:


First, the Argent Security Center. A core part of the Argent experience, this web application helps to secure our users' data. It's a customer facing React app that interacts with the Ethereum blockchain and our own backend services.


Second, the Argent Javascript SDK. You'll develop, publish and maintain this product. This is a vital part of how we'll help millions of people access a new, decentralized internet.


Third, out Internal Dashboard. We have an internal view to help solve customer issues and keep our engineering team happy when debugging (also in React).


You'll have extensive experience building and maintaining web products and be fluent in JavaScript. Ideally you'll also have some experience of Ethereum JS libraries. In the role you'll work closely with the founders and a small team of highly skilled and experienced engineers and designers.


Requirements



  • 5+ years experience with building and maintaining web products

  • Fluent in JavaScript/Typescript and its functional style

  • Solid understanding of Javascript frameworks such as React/Vue

  • Experience with Ethereum JS libraries (web3js, ethers.js, ...)

  • Experience with Node.js

  • Fluency in written and spoken English


How we work


We work remotely, transparently and balance Argent with the rest of our lives. We’ve all got loved ones with unpredictable schedules, be they kids or cats.


Although we’re a distributed team you'll need to be based in the UK or Europe. This is because we find communication much easier when we’re in similar time zones and a short flight away. Within Europe you can choose to work wherever you like!


We get together for a week every quarter so we can collaborate in person, explore new solutions, and have fun. So far we’ve been to Nice, Toulouse, Brussels, Lisbon and Barcelona.


Equal opportunities


At the heart of what we do is making crypto accessible to everyone. We want the team itself to reflect that diversity so we’d strongly encourage applications from underrepresented demographics.

items.content:
Full Stack Developer Junior

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Travel & Tourism
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Keesy srl | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Rome

Technologies

php
laravel
mysql
angularjs

Job description

We are looking for a freelance full stack developer Junior for the development and maintenance of a platform with MySQL stack PHP (Laravel) AngularJs / VueJS.

Preferable experience 1-3 years of development with:

  • PHP experience: 1+ years,
  • Knowledge of AngularJs framework,
  • Knowledge of Laravel 5.x or higher platform,
  • Knowledge of the Git versioning system
  • Knowledge of MySQL databases
  • Knowledge API Rest
  • Understanding of responsive design and progressive web apps
  • Familiar with VueJS

They will be evaluated:

  • learning attitude,
  • ability to work in teams,
  • experience / attitude in environment / agile pattern

Commensurate remuneration on the experience and on the projects assigned

Remote work with possible on-site meetings

Apply now

About Keesy srl

Keesy is the first fully automated self-check-in service for apartments, B & Bs, residences and landlords. It manages every aspect of the check-in: collection and sending of guests' data to the police station, verification of the identity document in real time, payment of the stay, cleaning and tourist tax, signing of the contract. And the host is always informed about all activities thanks to real-time notifications

Keesy Points for the collection and deposit of keys are located in strategic points of arrival in cities such as stations and airports, are open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year to guarantee maximum flexibility. With Keesy Digital the host has all the services available for use anywhere in any currency. The Keesy Smart combines self check-in with domotic access to the apartment.

Benefits

  • Young and dynamic product development team
  • Agile team working
  • Integration development with great tourism and booking partners
  • Development innovative digital and technologic products
  • Skills learning for young/junior developers for growing opportunities

Job description

Soshace is an agency that joins IT professionals and companies all over the world on long-term remote projects since 2015.

You’ll get:

  • Freedom to choose projects and your geography
  • Safety with regular payments and reliable clients
  • Self-development on modern projects in tech stack you have experience with.

What our developers think about the work at Soshace:

"Company that makes remote dev work easy".

“The great opportunity to work in an international team and get a cool experience. Well, the opportunity to receive a high salary”.

“Payment is always on time, so you don't have to worry about it. Great projects variety, you can find really interesting projects to be part of”.

We’ll be a great team together if you have:

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience with JavaScript
  • 1+ year of professional experience with React or Angular version 2 and higher
  • 1+ year of professional experience with Node.js, Django, or Laravel
  • A strong portfolio of projects in which you have taken part
  • Spoken and written English skills on Upper-Intermediate level and higher.

Here are our basic requirements for you to check if you belong:

  • We use time-tracker to get information on your working hours
  • Projects last on average 6-9 months and more with a full-time workload
  • When the first project ends we’ll find you a second one and after that the third and so on
  • The hourly rate we offer depends on your qualification level:
    • Middle $20-$30 an hour
    • Senior $30-$50 an hour.

Due to our clients’ demands, we limited our geographical scope and the regions we work with to Russia and CIS, counties in the Americas, Europe, Oceania.

Soshace recruitment team would be happy to tell you more about our opportunity when you send us your CV! 

Apply now

Our clients are companies from the USA, The UK, Australia, Canada and Europe.

We are looking for a broad range of freelancers that are professionals in web development!

items.content:
Mediavine

Senior Front End Engineer

Mediavine is looking for a talented Front-End software engineer to join our team. In this role you will provide UI development for several applications and set platform standards throughout the Mediavine ecosystem. You’ll work with the latest frontend technologies and help decide future stack decisions. As a Senior Front-End developer other teams will look to you for expertise on JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to integrate with other platforms (like WordPress) or third-party web pages that collectively receive millions of pageviews per month. If you’re excited about working in a collaborative environment then this role is for you! Requirements Knowledge And Skill Requirements * 5+ years of relevant work experience with a concentration in front-end design and development * Expertise in CSS/HTML and preprocessors such as SASS or LESS * Expertise in modern JavaScript (ES6, ES8, etc.) * Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue); React a plus * Ability to lead and task manage software engineers and provide appropriate level of guidance and oversight to ensure delivery of engineering deliverables. * Expertise in building responsive layouts * Experience with modern browser technologies * Proven debugging and troubleshooting skills * Strong understanding on client side performance optimization techniques * Ability to lead and mentor other developers * Experience working across teams with different technology stacks Essential Functions * Lead Front-End development “task forces” to create specifications and deliver features in a timely manner * Code reviews and mentor other developers * Lead and take ownership of UI development related to Mediavine products * Work with UI/UX designers and other stakeholders to translate expectations into a working interface * Occasional travel may be required Additional Desirable Skills * Experience building/supporting design systems * Familiarity with Node.js and Typescript * Experience with bundle optimization (Webpack preferred) * Experience with continuous integration and caching * Experience with remote teams Benefits * Travel opportunities * Remote work environment * Comprehensive benefits including 401k, Health, Dental, and Vision insurance * Learning allowance * Access to experienced engineers with direct mentorship opportunities * Generous Vacation/Time off policies * Additional side benefits such as home-office upgrades, tuition reimbursement, paid gym memberships and wellness retreats, upgraded flights, cool swag and more * Salary: $95,000 to $115,000

Minimum Required Skills:
REACT, Redux, SPA Frameworks, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Babel, NODE

We offer 100% work from home / telecommuting and most of our team is distributed
If you are a Senior Front End Developer in San Ramon ready to make a great career move and would like to join a fast growing team building out REACTjs applications for digital media management / delivery please read on!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

-Wonderful location in San Ramon, CA (if you decide to visit the office or come in for a meeting or happen to be local to this area)
-Our work environment is different than your used to in all the right ways! We encourage growth, collaboration and creativity.
-Our leaders personally take responsibility in helping you reach your full potential. We pride ourselves on the happy and healthy work environment we have created.
-We are looking for applicants who are passionate about what they do and who will be just as enthusiastic about our company as we are. Diversity is key in creativity and innovation. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and lifestyles!

What You Will Be Doing

Building the front-end features / architecture for a piece of real-time collaboration software using React + Redux modern MVC javascript

At the core of marketing, digital media is where much of the ad spending is and our platform allows for seamless collaboration across different departments and locations for all ad resources that involve audio / video assets and large amounts of data storage.

We have successfully stepped up in creating and providing simple to use content management software accessible in the cloud and desktop. It provides a user experience far above our competitors. Our software uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to engage users in a cutting edge interactive experience.
Your responsibilities:

Delivering front-end assets / features and contributing to a framework written with / using REACT.JS modern front end user interface and supporting software.
You will be focusing on the front end development of our product using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. You will work alongside our UX architecture team to convert generated wire frames and high fidelity designs into functional apps and pages on our desktops, web & mobile platforms.

What You Need for this Position

Experience in:
- Object oriented JavaScript (3+ years) (ES6/ES7)
- HTML/CSS, JSON, REST, HTTP
- REACT is what we use though one or more of the following frameworks is helpful: Angular, ReactJS, Bootstrap, JQuery
- Source code management tools such as GIT
-Web Workers Model

Understanding of:
- Scoping Model
-JavaScript Design Patterns
- Data Binding
- Events and Listeners

What's In It for You

- Competitive base salary
- PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Relocation Assistance
- Bonus
- 401KSo if you are a good front-end developer with React + Redux experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

JavaScript, REACT, JQuery, HTML5, CSS3, Material Design, Bootstrap, React Native

If you are a Remote React Developer...

With an office in Austin, we are a Transportation and Logistics Solutions Company. For over 20 years, we have been perfecting our software to help companies improve their operational efficiency by employing the best technology solutions!

What You Will Be Doing

You'll work on improving the richness and the capabilities of our web UI and mobile app to support the growing feature set of our product, and deliver a delightful user experience to our customers. You will participate in the full life cycle of feature development from conception through support and maintenance, including fast iterations. This hire will advocate for usability throughout the design and development process, participate in regular code reviews of peers and contractors, and stay up-to-date with modern UI development including libraries, tools, browser support and frameworks.

What You Need for this Position

You should know most of the following:
- JavaScript
- ReactJS or React Native
- RESTful web services
- JQuery
- HTML5
- CSS3
- Material Design
- Bootstrap

What's In It for You

- REMOTE
- Competitive base salary and overall compensation package
- Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision
- 401 (K) with generous company match
- Vacation, sick, and paid holidays
- Life Insurance coverageSo, if you are a Remote React Developer...

items.title: Full Stack Developer - REMOTE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=29}
items.content:
Currently searching for talented Full Stack Developers for a full-time 12 month REMOTE contract!

In this role you will be design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems, hardware/software interfaces, and/or applications according to industry established software engineering principals and best practices.

You will be working collaboratively within an agile team to execute on the full system development lifecycle including analyzing user needs to determine technical requirements; developing technical specifications based on conceptual design and requirements; developing well-crafted and documented source code; integrating hardware using software; automating manual tasks; and consulting with the end user to prototype, configure, refine, test, and debug programs or systems to meet needs. Identifies and evaluates new technologies or methods for implementation and continuous improvement.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree with 4 years of experience. A minimum of 10 years relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of the required degree.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Backbone, or Angular
  • Experience developing APIs and RESTful Web Services
  • Experience with iterative development practices such as Agile or Scrum
  • Experience with ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, JSON
  • Understanding of and experience with Agile delivery and Scrum facilitation
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices (cross-site scripting and SQL injection)
  • Experience with DevOps, Automation, and CI/CD tools and practices
  • US Citizen

items.content:
• SpringBoot Development
  • Oracle and Liquibase knowledge a must
  • Responsible for development, programming, coding of complex and business critical Information Technology solutions using ReactJS, Redux, D3 and NodeJS to enable CX applications.
  • Responsible for documentation of the system, conduct unit tests, peer code reviews and maintenance of internally developed applications, evaluation and performance testing of purchased products. Responsible for including IT Controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application.
  • Lead development efforts, oversee work results, providing informal training and serve as a technical resource for other Developers.
  • Write code for the most complex system designs and provides consultative guidance on project with extensive size, scope and risk.
  • Write programs that span platforms. Code to and/or create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs)
  • Develops web-based applications using ReactJS, NodeJS, D3 and other JavaScript based frameworks and libraries.
  • Develops microservices and has extensive experience using GitLab, Jenkins, PM2, Clustering, other tools and technologies for developing a scalable application.
  • Work on integration issues and determines the integration approach. Coordinate with other areas for integration architecture solutions
  • Review code developed by other Developers
  • Write detailed technical specifications for entire systems (made up of several subsystems). Identify integration points. Review technical specs created by other developers.
  • Consult with other Developers, Business Analysts, Systems Analysts and Project Managers
  • "Scope" time, resources, etc. required to complete programming projects. Seek review from other Developers, Business Analysts, Systems Analysts or Project Managers on estimates.
  • Perform unit testing and debugging.
  • Able to debug most program errors.

*** High Priority - Exposure to a front end framework, like Vue, Ember, Angular or React. Java Full Stack experience **

Requirements:

3+ Years in SpringBoot XP

6+ Years as a Java Developer

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Obby

Full-stack JS Developer

verified
EU-only
**About Obby** Obby is SaaS-enabled marketplace for the lifelong learning market. Our software tools help independent teachers & local teaching businesses run their teaching business better, whilst our marketplace helps people discover amazing skills that they can learn from local experts. We are firm believers in the importance of learning new things and the positive impact it has on both personal, and professional development and wellbeing. **What we are looking for** We are looking for engineers to join our growing, remote engineering team to help us continue to build a better way of learning, as we look to expand our platform, and launch into more learning categories and geographies. The team is distributed and we are primarily looking for developers in a GMT timezone to work alongside our 5-person strong remote product team. **How we work** The engineering team is made up of Cikito Grande (no one knows his real name) who loves fantasy novels and training his cat to walk on a leash and Vitor *“I could have been a professional footballer”* Goncalves whose claim to fame is having nutmegged Cristiano Ronaldo as a kid. Our latest addition to the team is "Babyface" Sergio Freitas, who is the most sociable man in Funchal, Madeira. Design is led by Louis *"do you like how my socks match my tshirts"* Bennett and product team is led by our co-founder Max, who loves Bayern Munich football club and golf (yes, it is a real sport). We work remotely across a shared timezone and are focused on building new products from scratch and running a continuous growth process. We are building a product-focused culture and despite working remotely, try to get together in person regularly to have a good time. # Requirements **Who we are looking for** We are looking for an experienced developer with at least 3+ years of experience and is comfortable with React, Node and MongoDB. Additionally, we are looking for engineers who are excited about the Obby mission, providing independent teachers with a platform to share their skills and generate an income doing what they love. **Please note**: whilst we are a remote team, we are not currently looking for team members outside of the EU and within the UK Timezone +- 3 hours. #Salary $45,000 #Location - EU-only

items.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=53}
items.content:
Impala

Senior Frontend Engineer

Hello! Thanks for taking a look at the job description for Senior Frontend Engineer at Impala. We felt a little bit impersonal just throwing you right in there with words like “revolutionizing” and “disrupting”. As such, we want you to know that the person that wrote this job description apologises in advance for any clichés, tropes or sudden-insecurity-driven-panic-attacks that you might find in the description below. What Is Impala Now? Impala makes building travel software incredibly easy. We provide hotels with a powerful data management platform that makes connecting to software, hardware and room distributors extremely easy. Think Twilio for Travel. We launched in January 2019 and since then have grown at - quite frankly - a ridiculous old clip. Our technology is already installed in hundreds of hotels worldwide, on six continents and categorises more than 1 billion data points. We are a team 14 exceptional people split across engineering, product and commercial that have built a fantastic community. Where Is Impala Going? We’re supported by some of the best investors in the business, the early stage backers behind Deliveroo, PillPack, SecretEscapes, Zoopla, Trivago and more. They’re on board because of our vision - revolutionizing a $1.6 trillion dollar market that’s been out-of-date for 20 years. Within the next two years, 25% of hotel bookings worldwide will flow through Impala technology and the product that we’re building will support the entire ecosystem of travel technology (we already have over a thousand companies signed up). Anyone travelling anywhere will interact with products powered by Impala and to achieve this we’re growing the team to 50 people within the next year. What Will I Be Doing? Brace yourself for some bullet points: * You’ll initially work across our agile teams as a frontend engineering resource before becoming a dedicated member of one of the teams. * You’ll add features to our existing UIs and also create new UI products that allow our technology partners and their hotels to better manage their applications and data. * You’ll improve the security features across all of our frontend products. * You’ll add functionality to our internal tools that allows our support team to better service customers. * You’ll analyze and optimise (be that UX, performance, security) new and existing features to continually improve our products. What Sort of Person Are You Looking For? * Someone with significant React experience and good knowledge of JS fundamentals * Someone comfortable working closely with product owners, designers, UX experts and the ability to translate their designs/requirements into maintainable, componentised UIs. * Someone that is extremely collaborative, Impala’s engineering team is not political, everyone has great ideas and should be open to input. We have no space for brilliant jerks. * Someone who is passionate about customer experience and building high quality maintainable software that looks and works fantastically. Where Will I Work? This is a remote position (all of our engineering team and some of our other staff members are distributed). This means you can work from anywhere +/- 2 Hours of London, timezone wise (and less than a 3 hour flight). As part of that: * We offer an office stipend (you can furnish a home office or choose a coworking space near you). * We give you an additional significant start-up equipment budget for things like monitors, keyboards, headphones etc. * You’ll travel once a quarter to meet the rest of the engineering team somewhere in Europe. * You’ll have a budget to travel to team socials if you’d like to meet everyone in person more frequently. Please note, we only accept candidates in Western Europe because of timezone and travel time differences. We make no exceptions (we don’t have time to!). What Do You Offer In Return? As a member of the Impala team, you’ll have access to: * Working with some of the best and brightest minds in their field, helping you to achieve the best that you can. * A culture that celebrates success, reliability and building a great community. * A top of market salary. If you’re truly great, we’ll pay what we need to. * Equity in an honest-to-god-could-buy-a-yacht-later company. Travel is a huge industry and infrastructure is a huge part of that. * A minimum of 36 days paid holiday per year. Unlimited holiday means you never take it, we just decided to give you a lot. * A professional development budget. That we make sure you spend with frequent PD sessions. * Generous maternity and paternity leave. * Health and wellbeing scheme. Including access to Headscape, Meditation/Stress management, Massage Lottery, Health Food Voucher etc. * A bunch of great benefits, like private health insurance, cheaper gym membership, cycle-to-work scheme, an everlasting friendship with the author of this post, annual “un-sick” day and many more. More About Impala If you’re really, really, really, really excited to learn more then please check out our Medium page which includes more information about who we are, what we do and our culture. For more information on what it's like working here, check out our Glassdoor page. You can also check out getimpala.com for more information about what we’re doing.

items.title: Shopify Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Bluebolt

Shopify Developer

BlueBolt is seeking out Shopify developers to expand our growing Shopify practice in our Chicago,  IL Denver, CO and Duluth, MN offices or from the comfort of your own home. Our ideal candidate will be experienced in front-end web development and familiar with Shopify development. We are open to all levels of experience with Shopify and are willing to train. BlueBolt offers outstanding benefits, including 20 days of PTO, 401k matching, profile sharing, and much more. Our positions are professional grade and career track oriented. Responsibilities * Develop Shopify applications based on requirements and technical specifications. * Implement Shopify applications from the App Store. * Work with other developers to coordinate custom application development and integration into Shopify. * Operate within the dynamics of a team; exercising proper etiquette and project stewardship during all phases of development. Skills * Strong HTML and CSS skills. * Experience using JavaScript. * Strong UI/UX skills and a keen eye for detail when creating a web interface from a design. * Previous experience working on e-commerce applications. * Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills. Nice-To-Haves * Independent, detail-oriented, and can present oneself as a good change agent when needed. * Experience as a technical analyst; namely within the Shopify universe. * Knowledge of Javascript frameworks such as React, Vue, and Angular. * Experience with source control and build management tools; preferably Git and Azure DevOps. * Experience with back-end technologies, such as the .NET framework, and best practices. Benefits and Perks at BlueBolt * 4 weeks of PTO for everyone on BlueBolt Staff * Casual Dress * Flexible Work Schedule * Great Health Coverage * Medical (BlueBolt pays 100% for staff member, 50% for dependents) * Dental (BlueBolt pays 100% for staff member, 50% for dependents) * Life/AD&D/Short-Term & Long-Term Disability (100% paid by BlueBolt) * 401k with Company Matching * Intelligentsia Coffee / Premium Drink delivery * Regular Happy Hours and social events * Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities * Outstanding River North location + Easy commute for Pubic Transit We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=5, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=40}
items.content:
Remote Shopify Developer

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: eCommerce, E-Commerce, Enterprise Web Solutions
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Bluebolt | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

javascript
shopify
reactjs
liquid
e-commerce
sysadmin

Job description

BlueBolt is seeking out Shopify developers to expand our growing Shopify practice in our Chicago,  IL Denver, CO and Duluth, MN offices or from the comfort of your own home. Our ideal candidate will be experienced in front-end web development and familiar with Shopify development. We are open to all levels of experience with Shopify and are willing to train.

BlueBolt offers outstanding benefits, including 20 days of PTO, 401k matching, profile sharing, and much more. Our positions are professional grade and career track oriented.

Responsibilities

  • Develop Shopify applications based on requirements and technical specifications.
  • Implement Shopify applications from the App Store.
  • Work with other developers to coordinate custom application development and integration into Shopify.
  • Operate within the dynamics of a team; exercising proper etiquette and project stewardship during all phases of development.

Skills

  • Strong HTML and CSS skills.
  • Experience using JavaScript.
  • Strong UI/UX skills and a keen eye for detail when creating a web interface from a design.
  • Previous experience working on e-commerce applications.
  • Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Nice-To-Haves

  • Independent, detail-oriented, and can present oneself as a good change agent when needed.
  • Experience as a technical analyst; namely within the Shopify universe.
  • Knowledge of Javascript frameworks such as React, Vue, and Angular.
  • Experience with source control and build management tools; preferably Git and Azure DevOps.
  • Experience with back-end technologies, such as the .NET framework, and best practices.

Benefits and Perks at BlueBolt

  • 4 weeks of PTO for everyone on BlueBolt Staff
  • Casual Dress
  • Flexible Work Schedule
  • Great Health Coverage
    • Medical (BlueBolt pays 100% for staff member, 50% for dependents)
    • Dental (BlueBolt pays 100% for staff member, 50% for dependents)
    • Life/AD&D/Short-Term & Long-Term Disability (100% paid by BlueBolt)
  • 401k with Company Matching
  • Intelligentsia Coffee / Premium Drink delivery
  • Regular Happy Hours and social events
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
  • Outstanding River North location + Easy commute for Pubic Transit

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply now

About Bluebolt

Why Do you want to work at BlueBolt?
BlueBolt is growing, not just in one direction, but has a number of growth paths:

  • Ecommerce Practice is our primary growth vehicle
  • Consulting and Development services
  • CMS and Mobile Development
  • Enterprise Product Development 
  • Digital Marketing and Marketing Automation


Bluebolt is a fifteen (15) year old Digital Agency.  We do custom Ecommerce development ‘for hire’.  So, BlueBolt clients select BlueBolt to do custom development work for them instead of them having to hire full time development staff.
Some of the main reasons why our developers enjoy working at BlueBolt:

  • New, exciting website and mobile projects.  Our clients are solid, and they get vetted for “fit” with our team, just as our staff.
  • Diversity of Work. This is what developers appear to covet most.
  • Outstanding  team members…our developers are the best we can find. BlueBolt seeks to hire A-Level developer talent.
  • We are hiring for both BlueBolt offices:  Our Duluth Office is very soon to be open (September 2019) and our BlueBolt’s Chicago office is in River North, downtown Chicago.


BlueBolt Staff
BlueBolt works for its clients as Business Analysts, Strategic Consultants, User Experience Designers, Website Designers, Ecommerce Developers, Application Developers, Testing and Deployment managers, Digital Marketers, and more…anything to help our clients with the challenges they face, especially from an Ecommerce development perspective.

BlueBolt Clients
Ideal BlueBolt clients have very technical project requirements, so we rarely offshore development work, nor do we outsource/contract work to other agencies.

Our client portfolio includes such examples as these:

  • Membership Associations
  • B2B Ecommerce Solutions
  • Professional and Civic Organizations
  • Mid to Very Large Cities and Municipalities
  • Large Financial Institutions
  • Industrial and Technical companies
  • Online Social and Community offerings
  • Many More ... All with unique, interesting, exciting project needs!

Benefits

  • BlueBolt pays 100% of Employees' Health Insurance, Dental, and AD&D
  • 401 (k) program
  • Life Insurance
  • Collaborative Workspaces and Casual Culture
  • Every BlueBolt employee gets 4 weeks PTO
  • Outstanding Profit Sharing Program
  • Coffee, snacks, fruit, and refrigerator items on the house!
  • Only use outstanding software and equipment
  • Company Outings and Regular Social Events

items.content:
Lead Desktop Engineer (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Desktop Developer
Industry: Cryptocurrency, Financial Technology, Information Technology
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Exodus.io | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
node.js
javascript
electron
postgresql

Job description

Description

Do you love leading projects, reviewing PRs and have a passion for solving complex technical issues?

We are looking for one of the first lead developers to join us in scaling and maintaining our Desktop application. The will include architecture and implementation.

Our Exodus Desktop application is built on React and Electron.

What You Will Do

• Lead projects, closing issues and reviewing PRs.
• Work with designers and product managers to develop and continually improve the platform.
• Monitoring the maintenance and upgrade activities for all our desktop clients.
• Mentoring junior developers and foster collaboration across teams.


Who You Are

• Extensive experience building desktop applications with Electron.
• Experience building, testing and deploying optimization React and JavaScript.
• Familiarity with CSS transitions and keyframes.
• You know how to profile React applications and can read flame charts.
• You have strong experience using JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS.
• You’re familiar with the React API, hooks, and Redux.
• You have a strong foundational understanding of Node.js.
• You have a passion for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and alt-coins.
• Contribution to Open-Source projects a plus.

What We Offer

• Freedom to work wherever you want, whenever you want.
• Building the future. Cryptocurrencies lay the foundation of the internet of value, the next major wave in application technology and personal finance.
• Collaborative and feedback-driven culture.
• Opportunity to grow. The sky is the limit if you're hungry to succeed.
• Fair pay, no matter where you live.
• Competitive compensation package.

Salary and Payment

$120,000 - $160,000. We pay in BTC.

Our Hiring Process

At Exodus, we pride ourselves on hiring people from all around the world. We work with individuals from various backgrounds; some traditional and some a bit more unconventional.


Our hiring process focuses on 2 pillars.

• Efficiency. You can expect the process to take between one and two weeks. We know what it’s like to wait weeks for a recruiter to get back to you and want to be respectful of your time.
• Transparency. We anticipate you asking questions and will answer with the utmost candor.

We are committed to shaping a better world and have built our team based on empathy, radical candor, initiative, and humility.

Overall, our goal is that you have a great candidate experience with us.

How To Apply

Please send an email to jobs@exodus.io including the title of the position you're applying for and your first and last name. Please also include a link to your Github account or a code sample.

If you want to include a CV, make sure it is in PDF format.

Some of the questions we look to answer while reviewing applications are:

• Why do you want to join Exodus?
• What is your experience leading remote teams?
• On a scale of 1-10, how familiar are you with Node.js, React and Electron? Please explain why.

If you’re reading this on a site other than Exodus.io, please reference where you found the job.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Freedom to work wherever you want, whenever you want.
  • Collaborative and feedback-driven culture.
  • Fair pay, no matter where you live.
  • Opportunity to grow. The sky is the limit if you're hungry to succeed.
  • Competitive compensation package. (Including benefits for US employees
  • Free Hardware and Software

items.title: Junior Web Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=4, apple=8, java=0, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
• £25k-£28k pa

  • Permanent position starting asap

  • We welcome and encourage diverse perspectives


Who we are


Awesome Shoes is one of the UK’s leading online children’s footwear retailer, selling coveted international fashion and sportswear brands. Our portfolio includes some of the leading global brands in the industry such as adidas Originals, Timberland, New Balance, Converse, Kickers, Dr Martens, Havaianas, Hunter, Vans and many more.


Our mission is to make people's feet happy.


We fulfil every order from our warehouse in East London and build all our technology in-house. Our drive to be the best means we are rated #1 in shoes on Trustpilot.


We are a small team who are looking to expand in order to do more.


 


What we believe


We fundamentally believe in:



  • Crafting unique and enjoyable experiences — for our customers and colleagues alike

  • Disrupting existing assumptions and solutions, whether external or internal to the company

  • Everyone having access to the same products, experiences and opportunities as anyone else

  • Allowing and supporting everyone to reach their desired potential


 


What we're working on


We want to change the way people shop for shoes online. One of the biggest sources of anxiety when buying shoes online is knowing whether you've bought the correct size. We are working on ways to solve this problem through technology. We are also looking at how we can increase customer engagement and loyalty by providing different and interesting shopping experiences.


Efficiency is at the heart of our business. If there is a repetitive task, it can and will be automated. We have a lot of automated systems, from realtime product pricing to machine learning customer support. This has enabled us to keep our team very lean whilst still achieving growth and most importantly, customer satisfaction.


Our tech stack consists of tried and tested technologies:



  • Our backend systems and APIs are written in PHP(7.3)

  • Our primary database uses MySQL

  • We host on AWS and use (EC2, RDS, S3, ElasticCache, Elasticsearch Service, Route53, CloudFront & Amazon Machine Learning)

  • We deploy using Chef and version control with Git


 


What you'll be working on


We want to build the ultimate website which changes the way people shop for shoes.



  • Our main purpose is to sell shoes, so you'll be building products to browse products, seamless checkout experiences, order delivery updates and after care

  • You'll be building and improving internal tools such as warehouse pick and dispatch applications (JavaScript SPAs)

  • You will be working on the front-end using HTML/CSS/JavaScript as well as back end using primarily PHP

  • There will be a lot of variety in the work and the ability to work across lots of different aspects of the business so there is a big opportunity for learning and growth


 


What we're looking for in you


From a coding perspective



  • Required: HTML, CSS & JavaScript. Our internal tools are currently written in AngularJS.

  • One required: PHP, python or ruby

  • Nice to haves: Objective-C, Swift, Ruby

  • Experience with production grade software

  • Previous e-commerce experience is not required

  • A keen eye for details and the desire to create a great customer experience


From a human perspective



  • Be kind and empathetic to all people

  • Have integrity and conviction in doing the right thing always

  • A desire to learn and grow professionally


We don't care how many years you have been working or if you have a degree in computer science. We care about what you have done and what you can do.


 


What you'll get from us



  • Support to do your best work

  • 25 days holiday per year plus your birthday off

  • Discounts on shoes

  • Weekly catered lunch

  • Company pension scheme


 


The interview process


Once your application has been received the hiring process will consist of three stages:



  1. A short phone interview

  2. An at-home coding exercise

  3. An on-site interview (London)


At no point will you be asked to code on a whiteboard or recite any algorithms. We are a small team so our focus will be on finding someone who has the right attitude and alignment with our beliefs as a company.


 


Your application


You should try to include as many of the following:



  • A description of your work history

  • Any online profiles you use (GitHub, Twitter, etc)

  • Any websites/apps you've released or help release, including any portfolio or personal website you may have

  • Any libraries you've written or any open source contributions

  • Any other work you feel demonstrates your abilities


None of these are a requirement but they will better inform our decision making around your application.


Thank you for reading this and we do hope you consider applying!

items.title: Senior Full Stack Developer, Javascript [REMOTE] at Clevertech
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=17, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=20}
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer, Javascript [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

javascript
reactjs
node.js
sql
redux

Job description

** This is a senior-level position, we are not currently considering candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements listed below.
---

What is Required:

- B.S. in Computer Science preferred
- Minimum 3 years of professional experience  (A technical assessment will be required)
- Clearly communicate complex concepts verbally in English
- Full Stack implies a broader vision. You have demonstrated using your full stack abilities to serve the business need
- Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in North American time zones


What you’ll do:

- Code in Javascript (Node, React) while choosing modern libraries to develop in
- Collaborate with your friendly, enthusiastic and senior teammates
- Create clean, modern, testable, well-documented code each sprint
- Use github, zenhub and burndown charts to manage the development
- Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver technical requirements

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video

Wondering how Clevertech has a successful remote workforce numbering more than 150 staff, without tracking and monitoring? Check out our most recent blog post: https://www.clevertech.biz/thoughts/rr-delivering-for-clients-employees 



Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.content:
Senior Frontend Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Developer APIs, Hospitality, SaaS
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Impala | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London +/- 2 hours

Technologies

reactjs
amazon-web-services

Job description

Hello!

Thanks for taking a look at the job description for Senior Frontend Engineer at Impala. We felt a little bit impersonal just throwing you right in there with words like “revolutionizing” and “disrupting”.

As such, we want you to know that the person that wrote this job description apologises in advance for any clichés, tropes or sudden-insecurity-driven-panic-attacks that you might find in the description below.

What Is Impala Now?

Impala makes building travel software incredibly easy. We provide hotels with a powerful data management platform that makes connecting to software, hardware and room distributors extremely easy. Think Twilio for Travel.

We launched in January 2019 and since then have grown at - quite frankly - a ridiculous old clip. Our technology is already installed in hundreds of hotels worldwide, on six continents and categorises more than 1 billion data points.

We are a team 14 exceptional people split across engineering, product and commercial that have built a fantastic community.

Where Is Impala Going?

We’re supported by some of the best investors in the business, the early stage backers behind Deliveroo, PillPack, SecretEscapes, Zoopla, Trivago and more. They’re on board because of our vision - revolutionizing a $1.6 trillion dollar market that’s been out-of-date for 20 years.

Within the next two years, 25% of hotel bookings worldwide will flow through Impala technology and the product that we’re building will support the entire ecosystem of travel technology (we already have over a thousand companies signed up).

Anyone travelling anywhere will interact with products powered by Impala and to achieve this we’re growing the team to 50 people within the next year.

What Will I Be Doing?

Brace yourself for some bullet points:

  • You’ll initially work across our agile teams as a frontend engineering resource before becoming a dedicated member of one of the teams.
  • You’ll add features to our existing UIs and also create new UI products that allow our technology partners and their hotels to better manage their applications and data.
  • You’ll improve the security features across all of our frontend products.
  • You’ll add functionality to our internal tools that allows our support team to better service customers.
  • You’ll analyze and optimise (be that UX, performance, security) new and existing features to continually improve our products.

What Sort of Person Are You Looking For?

  • Someone with significant React experience and good knowledge of JS fundamentals
  • Someone comfortable working closely with product owners, designers, UX experts and the ability to translate their designs/requirements into maintainable, componentised UIs.
  • Someone that is extremely collaborative, Impala’s engineering team is not political, everyone has great ideas and should be open to input. We have no space for brilliant jerks.
  • Someone who is passionate about customer experience and building high quality maintainable software that looks and works fantastically.

Where Will I Work?

This is a remote position (all of our engineering team and some of our other staff members are distributed). This means you can work from anywhere +/- 2 Hours of London, timezone wise (and less than a 3 hour flight). As part of that:

  • We offer an office stipend (you can furnish a home office or choose a coworking space near you).
  • We give you an additional significant start-up equipment budget for things like monitors, keyboards, headphones etc.
  • You’ll travel once a quarter to meet the rest of the engineering team somewhere in Europe.
  • You’ll have a budget to travel to team socials if you’d like to meet everyone in person more frequently.

Please note, we only accept candidates in Western Europe because of timezone and travel time differences. We make no exceptions (we don’t have time to!).

What Do You Offer In Return?

As a member of the Impala team, you’ll have access to:

  • Working with some of the best and brightest minds in their field, helping you to achieve the best that you can.
  • A culture that celebrates success, reliability and building a great community.
  • A top of market salary. If you’re truly great, we’ll pay what we need to.
  • Equity in an honest-to-god-could-buy-a-yacht-later company. Travel is a huge industry and infrastructure is a huge part of that.
  • A minimum of 36 days paid holiday per year. Unlimited holiday means you never take it, we just decided to give you a lot.
  • A professional development budget. That we make sure you spend with frequent PD sessions.
  • Generous maternity and paternity leave.
  • Health and wellbeing scheme. Including access to Headscape, Meditation/Stress management, Massage Lottery, Health Food Voucher etc.
  • A bunch of great benefits, like private health insurance, cheaper gym membership, cycle-to-work scheme, an everlasting friendship with the author of this post, annual “un-sick” day and many more.

More About Impala

If you’re really, really, really, really excited to learn more then please check out our Medium page which includes more information about who we are, what we do and our culture.

For more information on what it's like working here, check out our Glassdoor page.

You can also check out getimpala.com for more information about what we’re doing.

Apply now

About Impala

Impala is a team incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) with an engineering team that largely works remotely within -2/+2 GMT. We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.

Our engineering department is entirely remote and for this position we'll support that too.

  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.
  • Frequent socials.
  • The ability to work remotely.
  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.
  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.
  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.

Where we differ is:

  • You'll be working in a company led by an engineer. You won't be asked to do the unrealistic and your skills will be tested and improved.
  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.
  • You'll have a demonstrable, strong role in product direction.
  • We have an incredible culture and community.

Benefits

  • Remote work possible
  • Pick your own gear
  • Genuine product involvement
  • Lots of opportunities for travel
  • State of the art office space
  • 36 days holiday per year
  • Health and wellbeing policy
  • Cheaper gym membership
  • Great maternity/paternity policy

items.content: Currently searching for talented Full Stack Developers for a full-time 12 month REMOTE contract! In this role you will be design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems, hardware/software interfaces, and/or applications according to industry established software engineering principals and best practices. You will be working collaboratively within an agile team to execute on the full system development lifecycle including analyzing user needs to determine technical requirements; developing technical specifications based on conceptual design and requirements; developing well-crafted and documented source code; integrating hardware using software; automating manual tasks; and consulting with the end user to prototype, configure, refine, test, and debug programs or systems to meet needs. Identifies and evaluates new technologies or methods for implementation and continuous improvement. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree with 4 years of experience. A minimum of 10 years relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of the required degree. Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Backbone, or Angular Experience developing APIs and RESTful Web Services Experience with iterative development practices such as Agile or Scrum Experience with ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, JSON Understanding of and experience with Agile delivery and Scrum facilitation Knowledge of secure coding practices (cross-site scripting and SQL injection) Experience with DevOps, Automation, and CI/CD tools and practices US Citizen

items.content: SpringBoot Development Oracle and Liquibase knowledge a must Responsible for development, programming, coding of complex and business critical Information Technology solutions using ReactJS, Redux, D3 and NodeJS to enable CX applications. Responsible for documentation of the system, conduct unit tests, peer code reviews and maintenance of internally developed applications, evaluation and performance testing of purchased products. Responsible for including IT Controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application. Lead development efforts, oversee work results, providing informal training and serve as a technical resource for other Developers. Write code for the most complex system designs and provides consultative guidance on project with extensive size, scope and risk. Write programs that span platforms. Code to and/or create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) Develops web-based applications using ReactJS, NodeJS, D3 and other JavaScript based frameworks and libraries. Develops microservices and has extensive experience using GitLab, Jenkins, PM2, Clustering, other tools and technologies for developing a scalable application. Work on integration issues and determines the integration approach. Coordinate with other areas for integration architecture solutions Review code developed by other Developers Write detailed technical specifications for entire systems (made up of several subsystems). Identify integration points. Review technical specs created by other developers. Consult with other Developers, Business Analysts, Systems Analysts and Project Managers "Scope" time, resources, etc. required to complete programming projects. Seek review from other Developers, Business Analysts, Systems Analysts or Project Managers on estimates. Perform unit testing and debugging. Able to debug most program errors. *** High Priority - Exposure to a front end framework, like Vue, Ember, Angular or React. Java Full Stack experience ** Requirements: 3+ Years in SpringBoot XP 6+ Years as a Java Developer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=19, go=0, nodejs=17, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=10, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=39}
items.content:
"NO THIRD PARTIES PLEASE!"

ABOUT

Our client is seeking a Senior Software Developer to help build their fast growing practice. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working remotely from their home office and must be willing to travel up to 50% of the time, as needed.

This is a full-time, bonus-eligible, salaried position with benefits and many other fantastic perks!


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop and manage e-commerce websites, web applications & web sites.
  • Analyze, design, code, debug, test, document & deploy applications.
  • Participate in project & deployment planning.
  • Must be a self-starter & be able to work with minimum supervision.
  • Work on Angular/React based Web and Mobile app based solutions and integration with external systems, viz CMS/CRM/ERP/Enterprise Grade Services.
  • Develop Node JS/SpringBoot based Backend solutions.
  • Leverage Rest/GraphQL to build an API.

REQUIRED

  • Extensive experience with Angular (v 2.0 +) and ReactJs
  • Extensive knowledge and working experience in web based NodeJS and SpringBoot applications
  • Extensive working knowledge in TypeScript and ES6 standard for JavaScript.
  • Exposure to GraphQL based API s.
  • Previous consulting experience.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.

PREFERRED

  • Exposure on Mobile application development for Android and iOS.
  • Exposure on using mobile development tools such as Android Studio/XCode.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of XML , XHTML, CSS, Modules i.e. API integration, Payment Gateways.
  • Demonstrable source control experience with Git & SVN
  • Two or more published Apps/WebApps/Enterprise solutions

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Currently searching for talented Full Stack Developers for a full-time 12 month REMOTE contract!

In this role you will be design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems, hardware/software interfaces, and/or applications according to industry established software engineering principals and best practices.

You will be working collaboratively within an agile team to execute on the full system development lifecycle including analyzing user needs to determine technical requirements; developing technical specifications based on conceptual design and requirements; developing well-crafted and documented source code; integrating hardware using software; automating manual tasks; and consulting with the end user to prototype, configure, refine, test, and debug programs or systems to meet needs. Identifies and evaluates new technologies or methods for implementation and continuous improvement.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree with 4 years of experience. A minimum of 10 years relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of the required degree.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Backbone, or Angular
  • Experience developing APIs and RESTful Web Services
  • Experience with iterative development practices such as Agile or Scrum
  • Experience with ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, JSON
  • Understanding of and experience with Agile delivery and Scrum facilitation
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices (cross-site scripting and SQL injection)
  • Experience with DevOps, Automation, and CI/CD tools and practices
  • US Citizen

REACT, JavaScript, Node.js, SQL, AWS, Full Stack Development

We are a cutting edge SAAS logistics company specializing in large orders. Due to recent funding and growth on team, we are seeking an experienced and motivated Node/React Developer to help them build out and improve their existing technology.

What You Will Be Doing

You will champion development of best in class web applications, consistently ensuring UI consistency and quality. You will create and deploy software building blocks that support the client's product suite, and work cross functionally with product and leadership teams to workshop and implement the best solutions. You will lead the standardization and improvement of development processes including technology selection, deployment steps and code review.

What You Need for this Position

3+ years of experience as a software engineer and preferably experience helping to lead development teams
- Node.js Guru
- Strong experience with React workflows
- Fluent in server technologies, specifically AWS
- Database skills - MySQL as well non-relational database experience
- Experienced working with API's/Integrations
- Enterprise application experience

What's In It for You

- Excellent benefits package
- 2 REMOTE days/week
- Profit sharing
- Gym reimbursement
- Strong 401kFeel free to email me resumes directly

items.title: Ruby CTO, at VC backed stealth fintech
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=6, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Key points:


We are launching a new finance product and looking for a very hands on CTO to lead the way.


Its a greenfield opportunity so you get to choose how things get done, the technologies and autonomy with approach.


Get to market fast, we are a startup with a small but senior team and do not like over engineering (so if you like to build for building sake then this is not for you).


Positive attitude is a must and desire to get things gone.


 


What's the opportunity?


We're looking for a CTO to help us support the way businesses, do business. You will be joining a very product focused team and will lead the development process throughout the product development cycle - from new ideas all the way to implementations. If you’re passionate about the craft and process of building an exciting product from the ground up and working with great people, you’ll fit right in.


 


Who are we?


CreditDigital is a well funded start up, building the future of revenue finance (our new product). We help businesses get access to growth capital fast and repay via a revenue share model without having to put their home on the line or loose equity. A true partnership.


We integrate with a suite of live data points, so we can create an unfiltered view of a businesses performance- as and when it happens.


 


What will you be doing?


You will have the opportunity to set up the standards in how the development process works. As a product focused team, we trust each individual to be autonomous and work towards are shared goals. We are fully committed in supporting one another in any way possible.



  • Act as a champion that drives product ideas from start to completion: from research insights, to workflows all the way to visual front end.

  • Prototype ideas to quickly access viability, we don’t need anything perfect.

  • Iterate based on feedback from the whole team.

  • Work closely with the product team to ship ideas.


What skills and experience do I need?


We are looking for full stack:



  • Ruby 



  • An appreciation of the entire product development process, from problem solving through to front end.

  • The ability to quickly built MVPs

  • Excellent communicator that can articulate the thought behind proposals.

  • Able to collaborate with the risk team and the wider company on strategy and delivery.

  • Frontend: our design system is built with Ruby, JavaScript and Sass CSS

  • Infrastructure: Heroku, AWS


 


Where will I be working from?


Normally you will be working from our WeWork, Old Street Offices but we are a remote friendly bunch so you can adjust your schedule as you see fit.


 


What would I be paid?


Our pay is within the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on London rates.


Salary is not everything. Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. We don't offer free beers or Coke on tap but rather:



  • 25 days off per annum plus bank holidays.

  • 35 hours / week. Normal working hours are between 10am – 6pm.

  • Work from home whenever. If you prefer to come to the office everyday that’s great, if you prefer to work from home 4 times a week that’s fantastic. Whatever works for you. As a team we will make sure you are not missing out by pushing remote first practices. Flexibility to adjust your daily hours. Visiting friends and family in another country, going to the bank or the gym, you only need to have an overlap between our core hours (12am – 4pm) for 6 hours. As an example, you can start at 8am and finish at 4pm or 12am and finish at 8pm.

We are looking for a Senior Front End Developer with a strong eye for design and an advocate for the user. This individual will write well-crafted, high-quality and easy to maintain code while working closely with our customers and back end developers to craft valuable solutions for our users. If you enjoy creating functional code that provides an exceptional experience, we encourage you to apply! **Opportunity to work remotely is based on experienceEssential Job Functions
  • Create mockups, wireframes, and layouts that promote ease of use and optimize how customers interact with all new products and features.
  • Able to work with core front end and middleware technologies, including HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery and UI MVC frameworks.

  • Capable of programming and working with APIs and Restful Web Services.

    • Bachelors degree.

    • Portfolio that demonstrates previous work samples.
    • Strong background in UX/UI design, methodologies and development.
    • Experienced in web-based technologies, including HTML code, CSS layout and JavaScript/jQuery, as well as Java and/or C#.
    • Knowledge in programming and working with APIs and Restful Web Services.
    • Must be able to deliver high-quality work across multiple projects, consistently and on time.
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills for all levels of the organization required.

items.content:
Work From Home Data Entry

We are currently looking for online support in our work from home Panelist Program. This is a legitimate opportunity for someone who enjoys sharing opinions about products, services and trends in todays market place. As a Team Member, you will be performing various jobs such as online data entry, performing email response, reviews, surveys and other online projects. This work at home job opportunity is very rewarding and will help shape the marketplace and influence new products coming to market. In some cases you will even get to see products before the general public and even participate in testing them online.


Entry Level Skills

  • Strong outgoing personality with superior communication skills and great work ethic.
  • Data entry and strong organizational skills.
  • Effective listening and analytical skills, as well as the ability to summarize information and offer solutions.
  • Familiarity with home computers and have at least an average working level typing ability.
  • You should be professional and positive and also possess a high degree of self-motivation and have the ability to work independently in your job.
  • Excellent time management and administrative skills with a keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to create, implement and manage processes to achieve set outcomes in a work at home job environment.

Other Requirements

This is an online work at home position, so you will be required to have the following:

  • Good Working Entry Level Personal Home Computer, less than 4 years old.
  • Legitimate high-speed home internet access.
  • Full time & Part time telemarketing position jobs.

Compensation

  • Earn from $2.00 - $70.00 Per Online Survey
  • Entry Hourly Pay $18.00 - $24.00 Per Hour

Apply

If you are the type of person who is self-motivated and comfortable working on your own at home, enjoy such work as email customer service, data entry and reviewing products, then you are the person we are looking for.
